intro: Eutrema okinosimense, commonly known as Okinawa sandwort, is a flowering plant native to the Ryukyu Islands of Japan. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae and is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming habit. The plant features small, white or pinkish flowers that bloom in early spring. Its leaves are typically linear and covered in fine hairs, adapting to the dry, coastal environments where it thrives. Eutrema okinosimense is often found in sandy or rocky soils, showcasing its resilience to harsh coastal conditions.
